content.description: Start on the left side of the anime boulder on the large block in the skirt of rock below the boulder. Climb through good edges and crimps up to a small arete feature and top out.
content.location: Left side of the anime boulder, around 150 yards up the drainage from the road.

content.description: Start on the beautiful half pad crimp rail at 8ft. Get high feet and jump to the slopey rail immediately above. Follow the slopey rails to a better hold at the top and an easier topout.
content.protection: Pads. The landing is a bit uneven so a good amount of pads (4+) is recommended.
content.location: The right side of the anime boulder. Reach up high to a good rail at about 8ft.

content.description: Start on the skirt of rock below the boulder. Work your way into the underclings then dyno for a slopey rail with a positive flat section. Work up a set of juggy edges to a big move to the top and easy moves pulling the lip. Much easier if taller.
content.location: 150 yards up drainage from the road on the obvious north face of the anime boulder. Look for a series of slopey ledges halfway up the boulder.

content.description: Start on the two edges in the middle of the boulder on the lip of the overhang. Make a few moves up and right onto big holds and mantle onto the ledge. Easy topout
content.location: about 100 yards up the drainage sticking out of the hillside on the right. The only real problem on this boulder. There is a small boulder about 10ft left on the other side of the drainage that also has a line or two on it.

content.description: Past the anime boulder in the drainage on the left side is a pillar that sticks out from the cliff line. This climb starts sitting with hands on the large ledge and heads strait up the feature with a variety of holds and balancy moves. Decent moderates have been done on the boulder immediately behind this problem and in the general vicinity.
content.location: About 100 yards past the anime boulder on the left side of the drainage. Tucked into some small trees.

content.description: Along the rim of oak creek canyon off of Schnebly Hill Rd is a drainage with a handful of worthwhile boulders. The climbs are all found above the road in the drainage just past (towards Sedona) the overlook. Most climbs are north facing and get little sun. The road out to the overlook requires a high clearance car and 4 wheel drive is recommended to get from the overlook to the boulders. Another option would be to park at the overlook and walk down to the drainage.
